attributes.action: A wider range of physical education must be taught in schools
attributes.background: The government has been encouraging sport to combat obesity for years but if children do not enjoy the sports which they are taught then they may decide that they do not enjoy sport at all and refrain from exercising in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the law dictates that children must be taught athletics, dance, gymnastics, swimming and games but there is no specific rules about which 'games' must be played.

If children are given a more extensive range of sports, such as water polo, they may find a passion for sport that they would never have discovered otherwise.

attributes.action: Make safe standing zones a legal requirement for English Football league clubs.
attributes.background: To prevent clubs from forcing passionate season ticket holders to remain seated during matches, and to promote a positive atmosphere for supporters.

attributes.action: Put a cap on the amount of hours an NHS employee can work in one shift.
attributes.background: NHS employees do life saving work. How can they successfully do their job whilst performing long shifts. There should be a cap appropriate so that they can continue to do their life saving work at a high level.

attributes.action: A Carbon Tax For Companies Producing over a certain amount of green house gases
attributes.background: The UK Government has set very ambitious Carbon cut goals, so in order to ensure that these goals are reached or even exceeded, a price on greenhouse gases emitted over a certain amount (of C02e) should be instated. This would help reduce the emissions of factories and companies in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: With Wind power becoming cheaper than nuclear and hydroelectric looking like the future of energy, companies should be looking to more sustainable energy sources to not only help improve the environment but to improve their revenue.

attributes.action: Change the law on gazumping
attributes.background: When an offer is accepted on a property it should be legally binding and gazumping should be illegal.

attributes.action: Harm reduction on Fentanyl laced Heroin, by giving away Fentanyl testing strips.
attributes.background: We the people ask the government to promote and give away free Fentanyl test strips with organizations which have a needle exchange program`s and charity's which help drug users. If opiate users have a means of testing their product for Fentanyl then it would reduce accidental deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.synergygroupservices.com/fentanyl-test-strips-save-lives/

https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/3kkea9/this-fentanyl-test-could-save-lives-if-america-would-just-embrace-it

https://beta.theglobeandmail.com/news/british-columbia/fentanyl-test-boosts-dose-reduction-rate-could-lead-to-fewer-overdoses/article34984749/?ref=https://www.theglobeandmail.com&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_medium=Referrer%3A+Social+Network+%2F+Media&utm_campaign=Shared+Web+Article+Links&service=mobile

attributes.action: Prohibit the release of pheasants into the countryside for shooting
attributes.background: Every year approximately 35,000,000 pheasants are released into the countryside to be shot for sport. They are often intensively reared and little able to cope in the wild, with many killed by cars.This non-native species also causes massive damage to crops and gardens. This practice needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Most pheasants in the UK have not reproduced in the wild but have been released. 25% of those bred in captivity die before the shooting season even begins. Many birds are wounded when shot and not killed outright. They are hugely destructive, causing damage costing thousands of pounds. On compassionate and environmental grounds, their release should be prohibited.
https://www.gwct.org.uk/research/species/birds/common-pheasant/
http://robyorke.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/gamebird-release.pdf

attributes.action: Alter the definition of rape under English law to include assault by penetration
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 states that rape is where "[the rapist] intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person B with his penis" and "B does not consent". People who are raped using an object or fingers are said to have been 'assaulted by penetration' and not raped.
attributes.additional_details: Using 'assault by penetration' to legally describe this act of rape downplays the experiences of people who have suffered in this way, and could prevent them from getting the support they need from rape shelters and therapy. It could cause additional psychological harm by preventing them from coming to terms with what happened to them, since 'assault by penetration' does not have the same stigma as the word 'rape'. So-called 'assault by penetration' can also cause PTSD, as can rape and other forms of sexual assault. The definition is also too simplistic as it does not take into account lack of consent in LGBT+ interactions and relationships, and implies that only men can rape.

attributes.action: Stop MLM distributors selling health and weight loss products without training
attributes.background: Products like weight loss teas, meal replacements and other supplements are currently being sold by multi-level marketing distributors who aren't required to have any formal training in nutrition. They are giving advice that they aren't qualified to give and this is dangerous to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
Multi-level marketing distributors can mislead the general public with promises of fast weight loss and cures for ailments, without informing them of the risks to their health or the side effects. This ignores the duty of care which qualified individuals (dieticians) have to adhere to by law.

By forcing the MLM Company to educate the distributors, the duty of care is passed to the distributors who can be regulated to make sure the clients are assessed with proper screening.

attributes.action: Remove all Tolls to cross over/under the River Mersey, via Bridges or Tunnels.
attributes.background:
The Mersey Tunnels have been tolled for years
The Mersey Road Bridges are following suit
The NW region  is struggling economically. 
Bring all Mersey crossings back into the National Roads structure, like similar structures in Wales and Scotland. This will develop a real "Northern Powerhouse".

attributes.action: NHS need to invest more money in Adult Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals
attributes.additional_details: The NHS do not provide adequate staff and there are very few things to do on Adult Psychiatric wards. Staff need to be trained properly to deal with situations they do not know how to. There needs to be more distractions and activities to do and more staffing to ensure there are people to talk to when needed.

attributes.action: Bring the limit to claim for unfair dismissal down from 2 years to 12 months
attributes.background: This petition is to bring the limit in taking their employer to a tribunal for unfair or constructive dismissal which you don't have much chance if you have to be there for more than 2 years, if we can get it dropped to 12 months it may give people in the work place a better chance financially!
attributes.additional_details: You must have worked for your employer for a minimum period before you qualify for the right to claim unfair dismissal at a tribunal. If you're classed as an employee and started your job on or after 6 April 2012 - the qualifying period is normally 2 years. It should be dropped to 12 months to give people a bit more security in work and to stop employers getting rid of employees under ridiculous excuses and giving the employees a leg to stand on!

attributes.action: Britisher should have right to make/change laws through referendum like Swiss.
attributes.background: This is the real idea about real Democracy. Through this process Swiss State have provided rights for public and opportunity to have a say in decision making to change or to make new laws for Swiss nation.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland general people can make new laws and could make constitutional amendments through a referendum . If anyone would like to make new law or would like to make any constitutional amendment in Switzerland ; he/she or group of people should get 100,000 signatures to support their proposal .

Please see Swiss Constitution.

attributes.action: Let councils borrow to build council housing. Lift the government cap.
attributes.background:
Private tenancies are insecure, expensive and many fail to meet basic standards. 
So called "affordable housing" at 80% of market rents is not genuinely affordable. A programme  of council house building will help address the housing crisis, and council housing pays for itself in the long run.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules severely restrict council's ability to borrow to build desperately needed council housing.
Council housing funding also needs to be raised to a sustainable level.

attributes.action: Keep EU food labelling regulations following Brexit to highlight allergens
attributes.background: The introduction of regulation EU FIC 1169/2011 in December 2014 means that the presence of common allergens are now highlighted on food packaging and should also be available when requested for unpackaged food. It would be a terrible backwards step if this progression in food safety was to be lost.
attributes.additional_details:
As a mum of a child with Cows Milk Protein Allergy, the legislation has made our life much easier, as i know it has many others. 
There is still work to do, particularly in bakeries and restaurants to ensure allergy information is readily available for customers, but it would be an absolute travesty if the legislation was to fall away when Britain leaves the EU. 
Please give your support to this petition to help keep our food labels clear and allergy awareness an important factor in food safety.

attributes.action: Place stoma signs on disabled toilets and add stoma changing facilities within.
attributes.background: Stoma patients have unseen disabilities and although entitled to use disabled toilets, often face verbal abuse from the public when trying to access them. Stoma patients need a hygienic area to change ostomies and this is not provided. Unseen stoma disabilities need protection and recognition.
attributes.additional_details: Stoma patients face prejudice from both the able and visibly disabled communities. Stoma patients are forcibly pushed and pulled out of the way when trying to access disabled facilities. 21,000 people are left with a stoma every year, this is a growing issue.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to spit in the street/road. You should be fined if you do so.
attributes.background: So I have seen a lot of people spit in public on the road or pavement. It is honestly disgusting. They should be fined. Countless times I've seen this, especially in the Hayes area. You should be fined if you are caught by doing this. This rule should everywhere.
attributes.additional_details:
Places like have banned this: Enfield, Central London, Waltham Forest Council.

Sources:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-25291274
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2430724/Fined-160-spitting-street-First-prosecutions-councils-tough-littering-laws.html
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/people-who-spit-in-the-street-in-london-face-80-fine-9912228.html

attributes.action: Abolish stamp duty for first time buyers
attributes.background: For the government to recognise the great difficulty experienced by first time buyers to find thousands of pounds of stamp duty while also having to raise very large deposits in order to get on the property ladder and therefore for the government to alleviate this expense by waiving SDLT for FTBs.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions for full time students.
attributes.background: The university students are unable to pay for their prescriptions as they can't work because of the full time education.

attributes.action: Make environmental studies a mandatory subject in the National Curriculum
attributes.background: There is currently a lack of knowledge about the detrimental impacts that human activity has on the environment. If a mandatory environmental studies subject is placed in the national curriculum, then this may encourage future generations to act in a more environmentally-friendly manner.
attributes.additional_details: Topics could include – climate change, how much plastic is in the ocean, the impacts of litter on wildlife and the environment, how to live more sustainably/eco-friendly etc. Practicals could include litter picking, tree planting, and outdoor eco-volunteering sessions.

attributes.action: Make it law for all UK citizens to carry a identity card.
attributes.background: Carrying identity cards would help to prevent non UK residents using our NHS without paying for the service, and also stop people getting benefits when they are not entitled.

attributes.action: Strict Law on purchase of Acid
attributes.background: Increase in number of acid attacks everyday. It is very disappointing to know the easy availability of acid. It is not the face or body they destroy, they destroy the whole life of the victims. Acid should only be available to license holders.
attributes.additional_details: Acid attacks in London are increasing everyday. People have started attacking in groups now. It is very scary to walk in the street of London. It has to stop now! Acid should only be available to license holders and strict law should be enforced on each and every purchase of the substance. Lets make London a terror free place to live again!!

attributes.action: Set the National living wage for all who work not just 25
attributes.background: Help more people into work and a fair pay living wage

attributes.action: Allow and help gay couples in the uk have children through surrogacy.
attributes.background:
For gay men in the UK it is not easy to be able to have a biological family.
Surrogacy is legal however it is an offence to pay a surrogate to carry a child but you may pay their reasonable expenses, furthermore it is illegal to advertise for a surrogate.
I'd like Surrogacy made available to all
attributes.additional_details:
IVF treatment for couples that are unable to have children naturally is a fantastic way to have a precious family. Gay women are also able to have IVF treatment to be able to have a biological family which is also a blessing, but for gay men there is no way of doing this.
Women around the country are happy being surrogates but you are not allowed to advertise this making surrogacy being legal very hard to come by. The greatest gift is a gift of life to someone that cannot produce it.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to increase leg room in public spaces when sat down.
attributes.background: There should be a minimum leg room space in places like cinemas and trains of 350mm from the edge of the seat of the chair to the back of the chair in front. This will improve the experience of all, especially for people of 1950mm height, the disabled, those with loads of luggage and children etc.
attributes.additional_details: It is really differcult for me, being of approx 1950mm high to sit comfortably on a train. I often have to sit at an angle which is not good for my back and my knees are always pressed up to the chair in front of me. Because I am twisted, it takes up space from the chair next to me and this reduces the space for anyone who sits next to me, which is annoying for both of us and embarrassing for me. Though this might lead to a slight reduction in seats on trains, it will improve the journey for all

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pellet guns to under 21's and require licensing.
attributes.background: Our country's gun laws are one of the toughest yet we still sell low-powered air guns to anyone over 18 without requiring a license.
attributes.additional_details: Every day animals are being shot at and harmed or killed by heartless individuals who see them as target practice. People are also being injured by these dangerous weapons. We need stricter control now, especially in this time of increasing gun crime. It is only a matter of time before their use becomes even more wide spread.

attributes.action: Withdraw the UK from the European Convention on Human Rights
attributes.background: We need to restore common sense to our country. It is time to put Britain first. We need a British Bill of Rights and Responsibilities. The formal link between the British Courts and the European Court of Human Rights needs to be broken.
attributes.additional_details: The Supreme Court should be the ultimate arbiter of human rights matters in the UK

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if there is no deal on Brexit by September 2018
attributes.background: Leaving the EU without an agreement on our future relationship would be catastrophic in economic and human terms. If the government cannot deliver, our sovereign Parliament should be allowed to implement alternative arrangements, including dissolution and a General Election, to avoid this outcome.
attributes.additional_details: When people voted leave in the EU Referendum, there was no suggestion that we would choose to, or have to, leave without a deal. The government has not made any practical preparations for a no deal scenario, and  negotiations are not progressing fast enough. If the government cannot deliver, Parliament should take over and use whatever means necessary to avoid a no deal scenario. As this will involve a loss of confidence in the current government, a General Election should be held.

attributes.action: Christmas items must not be advertised, stocked or displayed before December
attributes.background: It should be law for any businesses not to advertise, stock or sell any Christmas related items
attributes.additional_details: It is currently September and we can see Christmas items before Halloween items or Firework items

attributes.action: Formally identify Accident and Emergency Departments as a UK Emergency Service
attributes.background: Nurses and Doctors working in Accident and Emergency departments deal with life and death on a daily basis. They are currently not seen as an "Emergency Service" in the UK along with Police, Ambulance, Fire or Coastguard.
attributes.additional_details:
1) Formally identified as an emergency service by the government.

2) Sentencing guidelines to be amended to show an offence of assault against any member of staff working in the accident and emergency setting (including other staff assessing patients in the accident and emergency setting) to be shown as an aggravating factor in the Magistrates Sentencing Guidelines.

3) To make an amendment to the Emergency Workers Act 2006 to include Accident and Emergency department workers.

attributes.action: Stop funding political parties that dont take their seats in Parliament.
attributes.background: This petition is for the Government to stop funding abstentionist parties who fail to take they're seats in Parliament, and for that money to be redistributed to frontline health services.

attributes.action: Give all National Health workers free parking and free public transport.
attributes.background: for the last seven years National Health workers have had a pay freeze. But are still expected to pay parking fees to park at work which can be anything up to 10% of their wages, by giving them all free parking and free public transport.This would be like giving them a 5-6% pay rise

attributes.action: Increase the number of nights required for "Shared Care" in Child Maintenance.
attributes.background: The Child Maintenance Service deems that 52 nights of contact per year is "sharing the care" of the children. This equates to 14% of all nights in a year. This is not quality time or sharing. It is insulting to resident parents. Increase the lowest threshold for "Shared Care" to 104 nights a year.

attributes.action: Reduce Civil Court Fees to enable access to justice.
attributes.background: The Court Service made £100 million profit. The maximum court fee remains £10,000 to bring a claim and £1,090 to have a trial. Its time for the MOJ to review court fees to ensure we maintain access to justice for all.
attributes.additional_details: You are owed £220,000. You have some modest savings and need to issue court proceedings to recover your debt. You will have to pay a £10,000 court fee plus £1,090 to have a trial. There is no legal aid available anymore. You are prevented from bringing a claim simply due to the ridiculously high court fee.

attributes.action: Make March 29th Brexit Bank Holiday
attributes.background: Celebrate our EU exit

attributes.action: Ban protesters from wearing facial coverings during demonstrations.
attributes.background: With the rise of Antifa, Right / Left wing demonstrations and violence, the hiding of faces to thwart identification of those who have committed criminal offences has become very prevalent it is a hinderance to later detection and a detriment to security.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all mainline train services to carry a defibrillator
attributes.background: Carrying defibrillators on trains could save lives. This should be made compulsory.

attributes.action: Stop the planned upgrade of the M6 between J2-4 until other works are complete.
attributes.background: It's has been announced that works are to begin on upgrading the M6 between J2-4 to "smart motorway". There are works ongoing between J1-2 on the M5 as well as M6 junction 16-19. These should be completed first.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times through the Midlands are already frustrating enough as it is with the amount of road work projects on going. The highways agency should not be allowed to begin another project in the region until they have completed the ones they have ongoing at the moment.

attributes.action: End the right of Anglican Bishops to have 26 seats in the House of Lords.
attributes.background: Although only 15% British citizens are practising Anglicans, and this falls to 3% for those under 24. This is a continuing trend, yet the UK parliament allows 26 unelected Anglican Bishops to sit in the House of Lords. This privileged, undemocratic, discriminatory, anachronism cannot continue.
attributes.additional_details: The right of Church of England Bishops to sit in the House of Lords is a tradition that continues from mediaeval times. The UK is the only parliament in the world that accords a unique privileged status to religious representatives. Known as 'Lords Spiritual' these 26 Church of England Bishops occupy a position of political power that is no longer relevant in a country where so few identify with the Anglican church. If Bishops wish to represent UK people, why should they not stand for election?

attributes.action: Review the impact of Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012
attributes.background: In 2012 the the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of offenders Act (LASPO) was passed. LASPO has had a profound impact on legal aid within the UK making it harder for people to gain legal representation, leading to an increase in litigants in person & arguably preventing access to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see: 

Amnesty International Report 2012: UNITED KINGDOM: CUTS THAT HURT: THE IMPACT OF LEGAL AID CUTS IN ENGLAND ON ACCESS TO JUSTICE.

attributes.action: Ban betting adverts on all TV channels before watershed
attributes.background: Gambling and betting are now well known addictions that are damaging to health, way of life, and destroy relationships and families.

attributes.action: Make ear piercing in under 10s illegal.
attributes.background: I strongly believe that no child should be forced to have holes punctured in to their skin until they are old enough to understand what is involved.
attributes.additional_details: If you made a hole like that in any other part of a baby/child, you would have them taken away. Just because it has a gem in it, it's different? People say “It's better to get them done when they're little because they don't remember it”... It's not compulsory.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for UK Councils to provide recycling bins in all public areas
attributes.background: Recycling is a small but pivotal source of reform to our behaviours that can have a big impact on reducing the effects of global warming. The Government should not only support but enforce measures to reduce our carbon footprint by making recycling points commonplace around UK high streets and parks

attributes.action: Make any overtime worked over standard contracted hours Tax free
attributes.background: I, like most, work hard as my wife does too over 50 hours per week often working Mon-Fri and then Sat and some times Sunday to earn extra cash to give our family a better standard of life and we are then taxed on the extra hours even after our standard normal weekly wage has been deducted
attributes.additional_details: This would be a massive benefit to lots of parents and families and encourage more people to do a bit more and get rewarded and then help the economy by spending that little bit extra!

attributes.action: Stop the additional stamp duty for second home owners
attributes.background: The stamp duty on second homes is affecting the home owners market

attributes.action: Introduce 19 baby check questions in to prenatal & postnatal information given
attributes.background: 19 baby check questions may help identify if a baby has Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) risk. Should be included in prenatal & postnatal information from midwifes & health visitor. You are given leaflet about enviromental factors. Check List only available from charity which supports after SIDS.
attributes.additional_details: Studies show 19 question scored checklist may determine which babies are at risk of SIDS. It is based on many symptoms & signs that are not significant individually, but taken together may signify a risk of death. The Baby Check as a means of quantifying acute illness, can be used by parents to help them decide whether to seek medical attention. It can be used by health professionals as a tool to discriminate between those babies who should be assessed in hospital and those who need not be.

attributes.action: Health care workers to have deaf awareness training/learn basic sign language
attributes.background: Deaf means deaf! Not hard of hearing! To often in hospital people who are deaf are treated as if they are hard of hearing/ hearing impaired.
attributes.additional_details: They are faced with healthcare professionals shouting from the end of the bed and missing out on vital decisions which are made due to poor and ineffective communication. This needs to stop, basic awareness should be incorporated in there training e.g. Writing down for the individual and confirmation of understanding. Not just relying on ineffective lip reading and poor hand gestures

attributes.action: Make the PassivHaus standard mandatory for new buildings in the UK
attributes.background: The PassivHaus standard delivers buildings that are healthy, comfortable, and cheap to heat, with heating bills and resulting carbon emissions less than 10% of the average UK building stock. Fuel poverty and climate change can be delivered through high levels of internal comfort.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite the obvious benefits of the standard, the construction industry often requires more stick than carrot, with full take-up of the standard only happening in places where legislation has been brought about, such as Brussels, Frankfurt and Dún Laoghaire.

While the Building Regs are based on the minimum acceptable standard the building industry will deliver buildings of low performance, with high energy wastage, poor comfort conditions and contradicting design and living practices.

attributes.action: Ban the use of mobile phones in the House of Commons
attributes.background: Our MPs should have their full attention on the issues facing our country. You wouldn't be able to sit on your phone when you should be working at any other job, so why should they!

attributes.action: Require schools to teach year five and above about LGBT and how it’s positive.
attributes.background: It is important that children know about gay and transgender people as someone they know could be gay/trans or some might be gay/trans themselves.
attributes.additional_details: I got lots of abuse when I came out as gay because the people I was around did not know much on the subject. I also know many people who experienced this kind of abuse.
